tika.dc.description: One of Hardy's most unusual novels, A Laodicean features a heroine torn between the dilapidated aristocratic romance of the past and the energetic technocracy of the modern world. Paula Power's two suitors, a patrician Army officer, and an architect, representative of the new nobility of talent and enterprise & comically illustrates the great social changes that were taking place as Hardy wrote the novel. The World's Classics edition of A Laodicean is unique in its use of the original text of 1881.
tika.dc.publisher: J. M. Dent and Charles E. Tuttle Co., Inc.
tika.dc.rights:
Provided for free by epubBooks.com. Not for commercial use.
            This EPUB eBook is released under a Creative Commons (BY-NC-ND/3.0) Licence.
            Source text and images are in the Public Domain.
